revised_title: The Role of the Lateral Line System in Feeding and Prey Detection in the Halfbeak Piper Hyporhamphus ihi
tldr: The study examines the functional morphology of the halfbeak fish, Piper Hyporhamphus ihi, and investigates the role of the lateral line system in feeding and prey detection. The fish's elongated body, swimming behavior, and lack of specialized visual system suggest that they use the lateral line system for nocturnal plankton feeding. The research also describes the fish's dentition, digestive tract, body musculature, and locomotion, as well as the cranial canals that form an integral part of the fish's skull and lower jaw.
